Petition of Antônio de Melo e Albuquerque to the General-in-chief

Most Illustrious Excellent General-in-chief,

Says the honorary Colonel Antônio de Melo e Albuquerque, that he, the Petitioner, after rendering the services evidenced by the documents numbered 1 to 8 (which he implores Your Excellency to examine), Passo Fundo (brigade assembled and created by the Petitioner) and having obtained from the Most Excellent Senhor Labatut permission to go to his home in the village of Cruz Alta, adjacent to the same place, this was granted to him, and immediately in the same days of the Petitioner’s march, by an order of the day from that general dated December 8, 1840, the brigade under the command of the Petitioner was dissolved, creating from it a corps, without assigning any post to the Petitioner, nor forming the slightest fault against him! The Petitioner was astonished at such conduct, issued by ridiculous intrigues hatched by cowardly envoys; and seeing that he no longer had a position in that division, he came to this place and presented himself successively not only to the Most Excellent Senhor Alvares Machado, but also to the Most Excellent current President and to Your Excellency Your Excellency Your Excellency Cima da Serra and promoted there a new reaction, which Your Excellency Excellent Senhor Excellent Senhor Your Excellency December 9, 1840 until March 17, 1842, in which by Your Excellency

Requests from Your Excellency

Hopes to Receive Mercy Porto Alegre, May 24, 1842. Antônio de Melo e Albuquerque Honorary Colonel

Report to the Military Chest, General Headquarters in Porto Alegre, May 24, 1842. Conde do Rio Pardo.
